721301f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, from 39th to 40th Streets. Only No. 265, the corner house at 39th Street, will remain in 1935. In the center of the block Nos. 269-71 will shortly be replaced by two story Thibault (wall papers) showroom, then in 1927 a tall office building will be erected. Between this and the 39th Street corner house, No. 267 ("Floor for rent" sign) will be replaced about 1929 by a small structure. Another tall building will be erected 1930-31 on site of 275-77, S.E. corner of 40th Street. Buildings on N.E. corner of 40th Street were demolished in 1925.
About 1920.

712555f-a.text:
23, 25, 27 East 39th Street, north side, between Madison and Park Avenues. The zeta Psi Club has just vacated No. 25 and moved into
No. 31, which is not shown in this view.
0ctober, 1V21.
qift of E. M. Jonks.

721300f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, at S.E. Corner of 39th Street. The Soldiers' and Sailors' Club is at No. 261. No. 257 is the Delta Tau Delta Club. These buildings were demolished in August, 1931.
1921.

712560f-a.text:
East 39th Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Madison Avenue, as photographed across the lot that includes the entire east frontage of the Avenue, from 38th to 39th Street's. The distinctive residence at the corner is the home of the former George P. Baker. O'ershadowing this at the left, is the office structure, No. 50 East 40th Street. In the background appear the Chanin and the Chrysler Buildings.
May 27, 1939
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

East 39th Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Madison Avenue, as photographed across the lot that includes the entire east frontage of the Avenue, from 38th to 39th Street's. 721298f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, at the S. Y. corner of East 39th Street, showing the newly completed Administration Building of the Henry Street Nurses Association. This structure was the former home of Mrs. Goadby Loew, the daughter of the
financier, George Baker.
April 11, 1940
P. L. Sperr
